description: From Medieval Latin surplusagium, from surplus.

examples: A surplusage given to one part is paid out of a reduction from another part of the same creature.

entries.meaning: (law) Matter in pleading which is not necessary or relevant to the case, and may be rejected.
(finance) A greater disbursement than the charge of the accountant amounts to.
examples: one third-part of the surplusage of the estate of any person dying inteſtate, ſhall be distributed to his widow,and the reſidue amongſt his children by equal portions
